title: Token permissions in crypto: how approval-based drains happen (and how to shut them down safely)
keyQuestions: Why did my wallet get drained after I clicked “Approve”?
What does “Approve” actually authorize on EVM networks?
Can an approval-based drain happen without me signing a new transaction?
What information is safe to share when asking for help — and what is never safe?
What is Permit2 and why does it appear in my approvals list?
How do I revoke token permissions safely without breaking future swaps?
quickSteps: Freeze: stop signing and stop reconnecting the wallet to new sites while you triage.
Document: save the approval TXID, the suspicious transfer TXID, token contract, spender address, chain, timestamps, and the domain you used.
Contain: move remaining funds to a fresh wallet created in a clean environment (prioritize high-value tokens first).
Revoke: set allowances to 0 (or reduce them) for unknown/suspicious spenders first, then clean oversized limits; re-approve only bounded amounts when needed.
Harden: use an interaction wallet for dapps, rely on bookmarks (not ads), and audit permissions weekly/monthly depending on swap frequency.

recoveryDecisionTree.start: Unexpected outgoing token transfer and suspicion of an approval-based drain

branches.if: You still control the wallet (seed phrase not exposed) and only one/few tokens moved
then: Freeze activity: stop signing and stop connecting to unfamiliar sites
Move remaining funds to a fresh wallet (clean device/profile) if anything valuable remains
Revoke suspicious spenders first (especially on stablecoins), then reduce oversized limits
Re-approve later only via bookmarked domains and with bounded limits

branches.if: You suspect the environment is compromised (malicious extension, fake domain, repeated strange prompts)
then: Stop using the current browser profile/device for crypto actions
Move remaining funds to a new wallet from a clean environment
Revoke permissions only from the clean environment (avoid random “revoke sites” from DMs)
Rotate to a new interaction wallet for future swaps

branches.if: You suspect seed phrase/private key exposure or broad asset loss across tokens
then: Treat the wallet as compromised and do not attempt to “clean” it as a primary fix
Move any recoverable funds to a fresh wallet immediately (clean environment)
Assume all permissions and signatures from the old wallet are unsafe going forward
Use new wallets: storage wallet (rare dapp use) + interaction wallet (small working balance)

riskNotes: On EVM networks, allowances persist until changed; an old approval can be abused long after the original swap.
Unlimited approvals expand blast radius; bounded limits reduce worst-case loss if a spender turns hostile.
Fake “support” and fake “revoke tools” often target users after a drain; never share seed phrases or accept remote access requests.
Permit2 is a tool, not automatically a scam, but broad limits plus a fake interface can amplify mistakes.
